channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Internation Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day
item.description:
Sunday, October 15, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Internation Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day.

International Pregnancy and Infant Loss Day is an opportunity to remember the little ones held dearly in our hearts. The campaign runs for the entire month of October, however, is marked on 15th October with the Wave of Light. Whatever time zone you are in at 7pm on the 15th of October, light a candle in remembrance of all the babies gone too soon.

This Light Up is organised by: Pregnancy and Infant Loss Australia and Mater Mothers Hospital South Brisbane

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Dyslexia Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, October 16, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red to support Dyslexia Awareness Month.

Speld Qld and Code REaD Dyslexia Network and SPELD Qld supports people experiencing learning differences such as Dyslexia by providing psychometric assessments, intensive literacy programs and quality evidence-based advice and information. October is International Dyslexia Awareness Month. We would like to raise the awareness of Dyslexia, and support and empower those with dyslexia and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Code Read Dyslexia Network Australia Limited & SPELD Queensland

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Go Green for EcoMarines
item.description:
Monday, October 16, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to support Go Green for EcoMarines.

EcoMarines aims to educate young people on the impacts of everyday life and activities to rescue, protect and conserve terrestrial, freshwater and marine ecosystems and their wildlife through education, leadership and informed action.

This Light Up is organised by: Tangalooma EcoMarines Foundation

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 National Carers Week
item.description:
Tuesday, October 17, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support 2023 National Carers Week.

National Carers Week is an opportunity to recognise, celebrate, and raise awareness among all Australians about the diversity of Australia's 2.65 million carers and their caring roles. National Carers Week runs from Sunday 15 to Saturday 21 October 2023.

This Light Up is organised by: Carers Queensland Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day
item.description:
Wednesday, October 18, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day.

The #SpotOurSpots campaign for International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day raises awareness of the need for more accurate diagnostics, better treatments, further investments in research, as well as build hope for mast cell disease patients all over Australia of a brighter, healthier future.

This Light Up is organised by: The Australasian Mastocytosis Society

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: War Widows Day
item.description:
Thursday, October 19, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit White and Blue to support War Widows Day.

The annual War Widows Day, officially acknowledged by the Queensland Government in 2022, aims to increase awareness about the array of resources and support accessible to war widows and widowers. Additionally, it stands as a poignant reminder of the profound loss experienced by the families and friends of those who have served Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian War Widows Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: International Developmental Language Disorder Awareness Day
item.description:
Friday, October 20, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support International Developmental Language Disorder Awareness Day.

The RADLD International Committee hosts International DLD Awareness Day on Friday 20 October 2023. Despite affecting 7.6% of the population, Developmental Language Disorder (DLD) remains a hidden disability for most people around the world. DLD affects a person’s ability to understand and use their native language for no known reason.

This Light Up is organised by: Language Disorder Australia Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Lord Mayor's Business Awards
item.description:
Friday, October 20, 2023

City Hall will be lit Gold to celebrate the Lord Mayor's Business Awards.

The Lord Mayor's Business Awards recognise the best and most innovative businesses and entrepreneurs in Brisbane. The awards centre on the energy, drive and passion behind businesses in any commercial or industrial sector contributing to the growth ofBrisbane's economy. The Lord Mayor's Business Awards, will return this year for the 18th time.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Mental Health Awareness Month - Beyond Blues' Big Blue Table
item.description:
Saturday, October 21, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Mental Health Awareness Month - Beyond Blues' Big Blue Table.

Beyond Blue is one of Australia’s most well-known, trusted, and visited mental health organisations, providing a safe and reliable place for millions of people to access information, advice and support. We’re here for people when they’re well and want to stay that way, unsettled or struggling and need support, or in recovery and want to reconnect. Beyond Blue’s vison is to help everyone in Australia achieve their best possible mental health.
October is World Mental Health Month and this year we want you to join us by hosting a Big Blue Table to raise funds for the Beyond Blue Support Service. Host your very own Big Blue Table and help fight the stigma of mental health one meal at a time. Register today at bigbluetable.com.au.

This Light Up is organised by: Beyond Blue

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

We’re here for people when they’re well and want to stay that way, unsettled or struggling and need support, or in recovery and want to reconnect. Beyond Blue’s vison is to help everyone in Australia achieve their best possible mental health.
October is World Mental Health Month and this year we want you to join us by hosting a Big Blue Table to raise funds for the Beyond Blue Support Service. Host your very own Big Blue Table and help fight the stigma of mental health one meal at a time. Register today at bigbluetable.com.au.

This Light Up is organised by: Beyond Blue

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day
item.description:
Sunday, October 22, 2023

City Hall will be lit Purple to support International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day.

The #SpotOurSpots campaign for International Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Diseases Awareness Day raises awareness of the need for more accurate diagnostics, better treatments, further investments in research, as well as build hope for mast cell disease patients all over Australia of a brighter, healthier future.

This Light Up is organised by: The Australasian Mastocytosis Society



Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: International Stuttering Awareness Day
item.description:
Sunday, October 22, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Sea Green to support International Stuttering Awareness Day.

STUTTA's vision is a world in which people who stutter are given the space, time, and opportunity to speak. We exist to encourage and empower people who stutter to embrace their individual journeys. We will fight against discrimination of people who stutter based on the way that they speak; provide education about therapy options, and advocate for the individual’s right to pursue or reject them; provide a space for allies to learn how to support people who stutter. International Stuttering Awareness Day is to raise awareness about stuttering which affects 1% to 5% of the population, equating to 25k to 125k in Brisbane and 250k to 1.25M within Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Stuttering Association

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Dysautonomia International
item.description:
Monday, October 23, 2023

City Hall will be lit Teal to support Dysautonomia International.

Dysautonomia (pronounced dis-oughta’-no-me-uh) is an umbrella term that includes many different diseases of the autonomic nervous system. Over 70 million people worldwide live with a form of dysautonomia. The autonomic nervous system controls all of the involuntary functions of the body, like heart rate, blood pressure, digestion, and temperature control. Some forms of dysautonomia are mild, while others are fatal, but all forms of dysautonomia can be very debilitating. People with dysautonomia often suffer for years undiagnosed, due to a lack of awareness. With your help, we can change that!

This Light Up is organised by: Dysautonomia International

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Children's Week
item.description:
Tuesday, October 24, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Teal to support Children's Week.

Children’s Week is an annual event celebrated in Australia. A diverse range of events and activities are organised at National, State and Local levels to celebrate the rights of children to enjoy childhood and for the wider community to rejoice in their talents, skills and abilities. To learn more visit: https://childrensrightsqld.org.au/

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Rights Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Sexual Violence Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, October 25, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support Sexual Violence Awareness Month.

October is Sexual Violence Awareness Month (SVAM) in Qld. (October has been SVAM in Queensland for over 20 years.) Dedicating a month to think about sexual violence in our state - why it happens, how do we support survivors, and how can we help bring about change - acknowledges the importance and the wide spread nature of this social issue in our community. This month invites us all to work toward changing the incidence and impact that sexual violence has.

This Light Up is organised by: ZigZag Young Womens Resource Centre

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of World Teacher's Day
item.description:
Thursday, October 26, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Aqua, Green and Purple to celebrate the Eve of World Teacher's Day.

World Teachers' Day is a significant, unique, wonderful & highly appreciated way of promoting the importance of the teaching profession & helps to celebrate the important work of teachers. Quality teaching of our current & future generations is vital to Brisbane's, and our state's, future. Teachers have often felt under-appreciated in the past, and this light-up very successfully helps to recognise, celebrate and promote this crucial profession.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Education

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Day for Daniel
item.description:
Friday, October 27, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Day for Daniel.

The Daniel Morcombe Foundation holds 'Day for Daniel' annually on the last Friday of October to honour the memory of Daniel Morcombe. Parents, carers, and educators are encouraged to start a conversation with children and young people about personal safety. Schools and early learning centres conduct child safety education activities.

Day for Daniel is Australia’s largest child safety education and awareness day. We ask all Australians on this very special day to Wear Red, Educate and Donate to raise awareness of child safety issues.

This Light Up is organised by: Daniel Morcombe Foundation

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: MS Moonlight Walk
item.description:
Saturday, October 28, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red to support the MS Moonlight Walk.

The Moonlight Walk is an MS Queensland initiative that inspires Brisbane's community to get active and celebrate our great city, while raising money to support thousands of people living with MS. The event involves a 3km, 5km or 10km walk through the city of Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Grandparents Day
item.description:
Sunday, October 29, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange and Yellow to celebrate Grandparents Day.

Grandparents Day celebrates the contributions grandparents make to support families, shape futures and strengthen communities. It's a day to connect with older loved ones and celebrate what they mean to you. In Queensland, Grandparents Day is celebrated every year on the last Sunday in October. In 2023 it will be Sunday 29 October and will bring together people of all ages, cultures and abilities.

This Light Up is organised by: COTA Queensland & Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Sexual Violence Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, October 30, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support Sexual Violence Awareness Month.

Sexual Violence Awareness Month (SVA Month) is held during October each year to raise community awareness about sexual violence;promote the support options available to people affected by sexual assault and sexual abuse;uphold a clear message that sexual violence will not be tolerated in our communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Justice and Attorney General

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.description:

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support the Ladybird Care Foundation.
